org.apache.juneau.rest

Class RestRequest

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.servlet.ServletRequestWrapper
      • javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequestWrapper
        • org.apache.juneau.rest.RestRequest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    HttpServletRequest, ServletRequest

    public final class RestRequest
extends HttpServletRequestWrapper
    Represents an HTTP request for a REST resource.

    Equivalent to HttpServletRequest except with some additional convenience methods.

    For reference, given the URL "http://localhost:9080/contextRoot/servletPath/foo?bar=baz#qux", the following methods return the following values....

    MethodValue
    getContextPath()/contextRoot
    getPathInfo()/foo
    getPathTranslated()path-to-deployed-war-on-filesystem/foo
    getQueryString()bar=baz
    getRequestURI()/contextRoot/servletPath/foo
    getRequestURL()http://localhost:9080/contextRoot/servletPath/foo
    getServletPath()/servletPath

    Refer to REST Servlet API for information about using this class.

    • Field Summary

      • getHeader

        public String getHeader(String name)
        Returns the specified header value, or null if the header doesn't exist.

        If allowHeaderParams init parameter is true, then first looks for &HeaderName=x in the URL query string.

        Specified by:
        getHeader in interface HttpServletRequest
        Overrides:
        getHeader in class HttpServletRequestWrapper

      • getHeader

        public String getHeader(String name,
                        String def)
        Returns the specified header value, or a default value if the header doesn't exist.

        If allowHeaderParams init parameter is true, then first looks for &HeaderName=x in the URL query string.

        Parameters:
        name - The HTTP header name.
        def - The default value to return if the header value isn't found.
        Returns:
        The header value, or the default value if the header isn't present.

      • getHeader

        public <T> T getHeader(String name,
                       Class<T> type)
        Returns the specified header value converted to a POJO.

        The type can be any POJO type convertable from a String (See POJOs Convertable From Strings).

        Examples:

        // Parse into an integer. int myheader = req.getHeader("My-Header", int.class); // Parse a UUID. UUID myheader = req.getHeader("My-Header", UUID.class);

        Type Parameters:
        T - The class type to convert the header value to.
        Parameters:
        name - The HTTP header name.
        type - The class type to convert the header value to.
        Returns:
        The parameter value converted to the specified class type.

      • getHeader

        public <T> T getHeader(String name,
                       T def,
                       Class<T> type)
        Same as getHeader(String, Class) but returns a default value if not found.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The class type to convert the header value to.
        Parameters:
        name - The HTTP header name.
        def - The default value if the header was not specified or is null.
        type - The class type to convert the header value to.
        Returns:
        The parameter value converted to the specified class type.

      • getHeader

        public <T> T getHeader(String name,
                       Type type,
                       Type... args)
        Returns the specified header value converted to a POJO.

        The type can be any POJO type convertable from a String (See POJOs Convertable From Strings).

        Examples:

        // Parse into a linked-list of strings. List<String> myheader = req.getHeader("My-Header", LinkedList.class, String.class);

        Type Parameters:
        T - The class type to convert the header value to.
        Parameters:
        name - The HTTP header name.
        type - The type of object to create.
        Can be any of the following: ClassMeta, Class, ParameterizedType, GenericArrayType
        args - The type arguments of the class if it's a collection or map.
        Can be any of the following: ClassMeta, Class, ParameterizedType, GenericArrayType
        Ignored if the main type is not a map or collection.
        Returns:
        The parameter value converted to the specified class type.

      • getHeaders

        public ObjectMap getHeaders()
        Returns all the request headers as an ObjectMap.

        Altering entries in this map does not alter headers in the underlying request.

        Returns:
        The request headers. Never null.

        Specified by:

      • getMediaType

        public MediaType getMediaType()
        Returns the Content-Type header value on the request, stripped of any parameters such as ";charset=X".

        Example: "text/json".

        If the content type is not specified, and the content is specified via a &body query parameter, the content type is assumed to be "text/uon". Otherwise, the content type is assumed to be "text/json".

        Returns:
        The Content-Type media-type header value on the request.

      • getTimeZone

        public TimeZone getTimeZone()
        Returns the Time-Zone header value on the request if there is one.

        Example: "GMT".

        Returns:
        The Time-Zone header value on the request, or null if not present.

      • getSupportedMediaTypes

        public List<MediaType> getSupportedMediaTypes()
        Returns the media types that are valid for Content-Type headers on the request.
        Returns:
        The set of media types registered in the parser group of this request.

                              Object value)

      • getQueryParameter

        public String getQueryParameter(String name)
        Returns a query parameter value.

        Same as ServletRequestWrapper.getParameter(String) except only looks in the URL string, not parameters from URL-Encoded FORM posts.

        This method can be used to retrieve a parameter without triggering the underlying servlet API to load and parse the request body.

        Parameters:
        name - The URL parameter name.
        Returns:
        The parameter value, or null if parameter not specified or has no value (e.g. "&foo".

      • getQueryParameter

        public String getQueryParameter(String name,
                                String def)
        Same as getQueryParameter(String) but returns the specified default value if the query parameter was not specified.
        Parameters:
        name - The URL parameter name.
        def - The default value.
        Returns:
        The parameter value, or the default value if parameter not specified or has no value (e.g. "&foo".

      • getQueryParameter

        public <T> T getQueryParameter(String name,
                               Class<T> type)
                        throws ParseException
        Returns the specified query parameter value converted to a POJO.

        This method can be used to retrieve a parameter without triggering the underlying servlet API to load and parse the request body.

        Examples:

        // Parse into an integer. int myparam = req.getQueryParameter("myparam", int.class); // Parse into an int array. int[] myparam = req.getQueryParameter("myparam", int[].class); // Parse into a bean. MyBean myparam = req.getQueryParameter("myparam", MyBean.class); // Parse into a linked-list of objects. List myparam = req.getQueryParameter("myparam", LinkedList.class); // Parse into a map of object keys/values. Map myparam = req.getQueryParameter("myparam", TreeMap.class);

        Type Parameters:
        T - The class type to convert the parameter value to.
        Parameters:
        name - The parameter name.
        type - The class type to convert the parameter value to.
        Returns:
        The parameter value converted to the specified class type.
        Throws:
        ParseException

      • getQueryParameter

        public <T> T getQueryParameter(String name,
                               T def,
                               Class<T> type)
                        throws ParseException
        Same as getQueryParameter(String, Class) except returns a default value if not found.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The class type to convert the parameter value to.
        Parameters:
        name - The parameter name.
        def - The default value if the parameter was not specified or is null.
        type - The class type to convert the parameter value to.
        Returns:
        The parameter value converted to the specified class type.
        Throws:
        ParseException

      • getQueryParameter

        public <T> T getQueryParameter(String name,
                               Type type,
                               Type... args)
                        throws ParseException
        Returns the specified query parameter value converted to a POJO.

        This method can be used to retrieve a parameter without triggering the underlying servlet API to load and parse the request body.

        Use this method if you want to parse into a parameterized Map/Collection object.

        Examples:

        // Parse into a linked-list of strings. Listt<String> myparam = req.getQueryParameter("myparam", LinkedList.class, String.class); // Parse into a linked-list of linked-lists of strings. Listt<List<String>> myparam = req.getQueryParameter("myparam", LinkedList.class, LinkedList.class, String.class); // Parse into a map of string keys/values. Map<String,String> myparam = req.getQueryParameter("myparam", TreeMap.class, String.class, String.class); // Parse into a map containing string keys and values of lists containing beans. Map<String,List<MyBean>> myparam = req.getQueryParameter("myparam", TreeMap.class, String.class, List.class, MyBean.class);

        Type Parameters:
        T - The class type to convert the parameter value to.
        Parameters:
        name - The parameter name.
        type - The type of object to create.
        Can be any of the following: ClassMeta, Class, ParameterizedType, GenericArrayType
        args - The type arguments of the class if it's a collection or map.
        Can be any of the following: ClassMeta, Class, ParameterizedType, GenericArrayType
        Ignored if the main type is not a map or collection.
        Returns:
        The parameter value converted to the specified class type.
        Throws:
        ParseException

      • getQueryParameter

        public <T> T getQueryParameter(String name,
                               Object def,
                               Type type,
                               Type... args)
                        throws ParseException
        Same as getQueryParameter(String, Class) except returns a default value if not found.

        Can be any of the following: ClassMeta, Class, ParameterizedType, GenericArrayType
        args - The type arguments of the class if it's a collection or map.
        Can be any of the following: ClassMeta, Class, ParameterizedType, GenericArrayType
        Ignored if the main type is not a map or collection.
        def - The default value if the parameter was not specified or is null.
        Returns:
        The parameter value converted to the specified class type.
        Throws:
        ParseException

      • getQueryParameters

        public <T> T getQueryParameters(String name,
                                Class<T> c)
                         throws ParseException
        Same as getQueryParameter(String, Class) except for use on multi-part parameters (e.g. "&key=1&key=2&key=3" instead of "&key=(1,2,3)").

        This method must only be called when parsing into classes of type Collection or array.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The class type to convert the parameter value to.
        Parameters:
        name - The query parameter name.
        c - The class type to convert the parameter value to.
        Returns:
        The query parameter value converted to the specified class type.
        Throws:
        ParseException

      • getQueryParameters

        public <T> T getQueryParameters(String name,
                                Type type,
                                Type... args)
                         throws ParseException
        Same as getQueryParameter(String, Type, Type...) except for use on multi-part parameters (e.g. "&key=1&key=2&key=3" instead of "&key=(1,2,3)").

        This method must only be called when parsing into classes of type Collection or array.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The class type to convert the parameter value to.
        Parameters:
        name - The query parameter name.
        type - The type of object to create.
        Can be any of the following: ClassMeta, Class, ParameterizedType, GenericArrayType
        args - The type arguments of the class if it's a collection or map.
        Can be any of the following: ClassMeta, Class, ParameterizedType, GenericArrayType
        Ignored if the main type is not a map or collection.
        Returns:
        The query parameter value converted to the specified class type.
        Throws:
        ParseException

      • getQueryParameters

        public String[] getQueryParameters(String name)
        Returns the list of all query parameters with the specified name.

        Same as ServletRequestWrapper.getParameterValues(String) except only looks in the URL string, not parameters from URL-Encoded FORM posts.

        This method can be used to retrieve parameters without triggering the underlying servlet API to load and parse the request body.

        Parameters:
        name -
        Returns:
        the list of query parameters, or null if the parameter does not exist.

      • hasQueryParameter

        public boolean hasQueryParameter(String name)
        Returns true if the query parameters on this request contains the specified entry.

        Note that this returns true even if the value is set to null (e.g. "?key").

        This method can be used to check the existence of a parameter without triggering the underlying servlet API to load and parse the request body.

        Parameters:
        name - The URL parameter name.
        Returns:
        true if the URL parameters on this request contains the specified entry.

      • hasAnyQueryParameters

        public boolean hasAnyQueryParameters(String... params)
        Returns true if the request contains any of the specified query parameters.
        Parameters:
        params - The list of parameters to check for.
        Returns:
        true if the request contains any of the specified query parameters.

      • getQueryParameterMap

        public Map<String,String[]> getQueryParameterMap()
        Equivalent to ServletRequestWrapper.getParameterMap(), but only looks for query parameters in the URL, not form posts.

        This method can be used to retrieve query parameters without triggering the underlying servlet API to load and parse the request body.

        This object is modifiable.

        Returns:
        The query parameters as a modifiable map.

      • getQueryParameterNames

        public Iterator<String> getQueryParameterNames()
        Equivalent to ServletRequestWrapper.getParameterNames(), but only looks for query parameters in the URL, not form posts.

        This method can be used to retrieve query parameters without triggering the underlying servlet API to load and parse the request body.

        This object is modifiable.

        Returns:
        An iterator of query parameter names.

      • setFormDataParameter

        public void setFormDataParameter(String name,
                                 Object value)
        Sets a request form data parameter value.
        Parameters:
        name - The parameter name.
        value - The parameter value.

      • getFormDataParameter

        public String getFormDataParameter(String name)
        Returns a form data parameter value.

        Parameter lookup is case-insensitive (consistent with WAS, but differs from Tomcat).

        Notes:
        • Calling this method on URL-Encoded FORM posts causes the body content to be loaded and parsed by the underlying servlet API.
        • This method returns the raw unparsed value, and differs from calling getFormDataParameter(name, String.class) which will convert the value from UON notation:
          • "null" => null
          • "'null'" => "null"
          • "'foo bar'" => "foo bar"
          • "foo~~bar" => "foo~bar"
        Parameters:
        name - The form data parameter name.
        Returns:
        The parameter value, or null if parameter does not exist.

      • getFormDataParameter

        public String getFormDataParameter(String name,
                                   String def)
        Same as getFormDataParameter(String) except returns a default value if null or empty.
        Parameters:
        name - The form data parameter name.
        def - The default value.
        Returns:
        The parameter value, or the default value if null or empty.

      • getFormDataParameter

        public <T> T getFormDataParameter(String name,
                                  Class<T> type)
                           throws ParseException
        Returns the specified form data parameter value converted to a POJO using the UrlEncodingParser registered with this servlet.

        Examples:

        // Parse into an integer. int myparam = req.getFormDataParameter("myparam", int.class); // Parse into an int array. int[] myparam = req.getFormDataParameter("myparam", int[].class); // Parse into a bean. MyBean myparam = req.getFormDataParameter("myparam", MyBean.class); // Parse into a linked-list of objects. List myparam = req.getFormDataParameter("myparam", LinkedList.class); // Parse into a map of object keys/values. Map myparam = req.getFormDataParameter("myparam", TreeMap.class);

        Notes:
        • Calling this method on URL-Encoded FORM posts causes the body content to be loaded and parsed by the underlying servlet API.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The class type to convert the parameter value to.
        Parameters:
        name - The parameter name.
        type - The class type to convert the parameter value to.
        Returns:
        The parameter value converted to the specified class type.
        Throws:
        ParseException

      • getFormDataParameter

        public <T> T getFormDataParameter(String name,
                                  T def,
                                  Class<T> type)
                           throws ParseException
        Same as getFormDataParameter(String, Class) except returns a default value if not specified.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The class type to convert the parameter value to.
        Parameters:
        name - The parameter name.
        def - The default value if the parameter was not specified or is null.
        type - The class type to convert the parameter value to.
        Returns:
        The parameter value converted to the specified class type.
        Throws:
        ParseException

      • getFormDataParameters

        public <T> T getFormDataParameters(String name,
                                   Class<T> type)
                            throws ParseException
        Same as getFormDataParameter(String, Class) except for use on multi-part parameters (e.g. "key=1&key=2&key=3" instead of "key=(1,2,3)")

        This method must only be called when parsing into classes of type Collection or array.

        Parameters:
        name - The parameter name.
        type - The class type to convert the parameter value to.
        Returns:
        The parameter value converted to the specified class type.
        Throws:
        ParseException

      • getFormDataParameter

        public <T> T getFormDataParameter(String name,
                                  Type type,
                                  Type... args)
                           throws ParseException
        Returns the specified form data parameter value converted to a POJO using the UrlEncodingParser registered with this servlet.

        Notes:
        • Calling this method on URL-Encoded FORM posts causes the body content to be loaded and parsed by the underlying servlet API.
        • Use this method if you want to parse into a parameterized Map/Collection object.

        Examples:

        // Parse into a linked-list of strings. List<String> myparam = req.getFormDataParameter("myparam", LinkedList.class, String.class); // Parse into a linked-list of linked-lists of strings. List<List<String>> myparam = req.getFormDataParameter("myparam", LinkedList.class, LinkedList.class, String.class); // Parse into a map of string keys/values. Map<String,String> myparam = req.getFormDataParameter("myparam", TreeMap.class, String.class, String.class); // Parse into a map containing string keys and values of lists containing beans. Map<String,List<MyBean>> myparam = req.getFormDataParameter("myparam", TreeMap.class, String.class, List.class, MyBean.class);

        Parameters:
        name - The parameter name.
        type - The type of object to create.
        Can be any of the following: ClassMeta, Class, ParameterizedType, GenericArrayType
        args - The type arguments of the class if it's a collection or map.
        Can be any of the following: ClassMeta, Class, ParameterizedType, GenericArrayType
        Ignored if the main type is not a map or collection.
        Returns:
        The parameter value converted to the specified class type.
        Throws:
        ParseException

      • getFormDataParameters

        public <T> T getFormDataParameters(String name,
                                   Type type,
                                   Type... args)
                            throws ParseException
        Same as getFormDataParameter(String, Type, Type...) except for use on multi-part parameters (e.g. "key=1&key=2&key=3" instead of "key=(1,2,3)")

        This method must only be called when parsing into classes of type Collection or array.

        Parameters:
        name - The parameter name.
        type - The type of object to create.
        Can be any of the following: ClassMeta, Class, ParameterizedType, GenericArrayType
        args - The type arguments of the class if it's a collection or map.
        Can be any of the following: ClassMeta, Class, ParameterizedType, GenericArrayType
        Ignored if the main type is not a map or collection.
        Returns:
        The parameter value converted to the specified class type.
        Throws:
        ParseException

      • hasFormDataParameter

        public boolean hasFormDataParameter(String name)
        Returns true if the form data parameters on this request contains the specified entry.

        Note that this returns true even if the value is set to null (e.g. "?key").

        Parameters:
        name - The URL parameter name.
        Returns:
        true if the URL parameters on this request contains the specified entry.

                             String value)

        A path parameter is a variable in the path pattern such as "/{foo}"

        Parameters:

        value - The parameter value.

        A path parameter is a variable in the path pattern such as "/{foo}"

        Returns:

      • getPathParameter

        public <T> T getPathParameter(String name,
                              Class<T> type)
                       throws ParseException
        Returns the specified path parameter converted to a POJO.

        The type can be any POJO type convertable from a String (See POJOs Convertable From Strings).

        Examples:

        // Parse into an integer. int myparam = req.getPathParameter("myparam", int.class); // Parse into an int array. int[] myparam = req.getPathParameter("myparam", int[].class); // Parse into a bean. MyBean myparam = req.getPathParameter("myparam", MyBean.class); // Parse into a linked-list of objects. List myparam = req.getPathParameter("myparam", LinkedList.class); // Parse into a map of object keys/values. Map myparam = req.getPathParameter("myparam", TreeMap.class);

        Type Parameters:
        T - The class type to convert the attribute value to.
        Parameters:
        name - The attribute name.
        type - The class type to convert the attribute value to.
        Returns:
        The attribute value converted to the specified class type.
        Throws:
        ParseException

      • getPathParameter

        public <T> T getPathParameter(String name,
                              Type type,
                              Type... args)
                       throws ParseException
        Returns the specified path parameter converted to a POJO.

        The type can be any POJO type convertable from a String (See POJOs Convertable From Strings).

        Use this method if you want to parse into a parameterized Map/Collection object.

        Examples:

        // Parse into a linked-list of strings. List<String> myparam = req.getPathParameter("myparam", LinkedList.class, String.class); // Parse into a linked-list of linked-lists of strings. List<List<String>> myparam = req.getPathParameter("myparam", LinkedList.class, LinkedList.class, String.class); // Parse into a map of string keys/values. Map<String,String> myparam = req.getPathParameter("myparam", TreeMap.class, String.class, String.class); // Parse into a map containing string keys and values of lists containing beans. Map<String,List<MyBean>> myparam = req.getPathParameter("myparam", TreeMap.class, String.class, List.class, MyBean.class);

        Type Parameters:
        T - The class type to convert the attribute value to.
        Parameters:
        name - The attribute name.
        type - The type of object to create.
        Can be any of the following: ClassMeta, Class, ParameterizedType, GenericArrayType
        args - The type arguments of the class if it's a collection or map.
        Can be any of the following: ClassMeta, Class, ParameterizedType, GenericArrayType
        Ignored if the main type is not a map or collection.
        Returns:
        The attribute value converted to the specified class type.
        Throws:
        ParseException

      • getBody

        public <T> T getBody(Class<T> type)
              throws IOException,
                     ParseException
        Reads the input from the HTTP request as JSON, XML, or HTML and converts the input to a POJO.

        If allowHeaderParams init parameter is true, then first looks for &body=xxx in the URL query string.

        If type is null or Object.class, then the actual type will be determined automatically based on the following input:

        TypeJSON inputXML inputReturn type
        object "{...}" <object>...</object>
        <x type='object'>...</x>        		 ObjectMap
        array "[...]" <array>...</array>
        <x type='array'>...</x>        		 ObjectList
        string "'...'" <string>...</string>
        <x type='string'>...</x>        		 String
        number 123 <number>123</number>
        <x type='number'>...</x>        		 Number
        boolean true <boolean>true</boolean>
        <x type='boolean'>...</x>        		 Boolean
        null null or blank <null/> or blank
        <x type='null'/>        		 null

        Refer to POJO Categories for a complete definition of supported POJOs.

        Examples:

        // Parse into an integer. int body = req.getBody(int.class); // Parse into an int array. int[] body = req.getBody(int[].class); // Parse into a bean. MyBean body = req.getBody(MyBean.class); // Parse into a linked-list of objects. List body = req.getBody(LinkedList.class); // Parse into a map of object keys/values. Map body = req.getBody(TreeMap.class);

        Type Parameters:
        T - The class type to instantiate.
        Parameters:
        type - The class type to instantiate.
        Returns:
        The input parsed to a POJO.
        Throws:
        IOException - If a problem occurred trying to read from the reader.
        ParseException - If the input contains a syntax error or is malformed for the requested Accept header or is not valid for the specified type.

      • getBody

        public <T> T getBody(Type type,
                     Type... args)
        Reads the input from the HTTP request as JSON, XML, or HTML and converts the input to a POJO.

        Examples:

        // Parse into a linked-list of strings. List<String> body = req.getBody(LinkedList.class, String.class); // Parse into a linked-list of linked-lists of strings. List<List<String>> body = req.getBody(LinkedList.class, LinkedList.class, String.class); // Parse into a map of string keys/values. Map<String,String> body = req.getBody(TreeMap.class, String.class, String.class); // Parse into a map containing string keys and values of lists containing beans. Map<String,List<MyBean>> body = req.getBody(TreeMap.class, String.class, List.class, MyBean.class);

        Type Parameters:
        T - The class type to instantiate.
        Parameters:
        type - The type of object to create.
        Can be any of the following: ClassMeta, Class, ParameterizedType, GenericArrayType
        args - The type arguments of the class if it's a collection or map.
        Can be any of the following: ClassMeta, Class, ParameterizedType, GenericArrayType
        Ignored if the main type is not a map or collection.
        Returns:
        The input parsed to a POJO.

      • getPathInfoUndecoded

      • getPathInfoParts

        public String[] getPathInfoParts()
        Returns the value HttpServletRequestWrapper.getPathInfo() split on the '/' character.

        If path info is null, returns an empty list.

        URL-encoded characters in segments are automatically decoded by this method.

        Returns:
        The decoded segments, or an empty list if path info is null.

      • getURL

        public URL getURL(String path)
           throws MalformedURLException
        Returns a resolved URL.

        • Fully-qualified absolute URLs (e.g. "http://...", "https://") are simply converted to a URL.
        • Absolute URLs (e.g. "/foo/...") are interpreted as relative to the server hostname.
        • Relative URLs (e.g. "foo/...") are interpreted as relative to this servlet path.
        Parameters:
        path - The URL path to resolve.
        Returns:
        The resolved URL.
        Throws:
        MalformedURLException - If path is not a valid URL component.

      • getServletParentURI

        public String getServletParentURI()
        Returns the URI of the parent of this servlet.
        Returns:
        The URI of the parent of this servlet.

      • getPathRemainder

        public String getPathRemainder()
        Returns the decoded remainder of the URL following any path pattern matches.

        The behavior of path remainder is shown below given the path pattern "/foo/*":

        URL Path Remainder
        /foo null
        /foo/ ""
        /foo// "/"
        /foo/// "//"
        /foo/a/b "a/b"
        /foo//a/b/ "/a/b/"
        /foo/a%2Fb "a/b"
        Example:

        // REST method @RestMethod(name="GET",path="/foo/{bar}/*") public doGetById(RestServlet res, RestResponse res, int bar) { System.err.println(res.getRemainder()); } // Prints "path/remainder" new RestCall(servletPath + "/foo/123/path/remainder").connect();

        Returns:
        The path remainder string.

      • getPathRemainderUndecoded

        public String getPathRemainderUndecoded()
        Same as getPathRemainder() but doesn't decode characters.
        Returns:
        The undecoded path remainder.

      • getRequestParentURI

        public String getRequestParentURI()
        Returns the URI of the parent resource.

        Trailing slashes in the path are ignored by this method.

        The behavior is shown below:

        getRequestURI getRequestParentURI
        /foo/bar /foo
        /foo/bar?baz=bing /foo
        /foo/bar/ /foo
        /foo/bar// /foo
        /foo//bar// /foo/
        /foo /
        Returns:
        The request parent URI.

      • getTrimmedRequestURI

        public String getTrimmedRequestURI()
        Same as HttpServletRequestWrapper.getRequestURI() but trims trailing slashes from the result.
        Returns:
        The trimmed request URI.

      • getTrimmedRequestURL

        public StringBuffer getTrimmedRequestURL()
        Same as HttpServletRequestWrapper.getRequestURL() but trims trailing slashes from the result.
        Returns:
        The trimmed request URL.

      • isPlainText

        public boolean isPlainText()
        Returns true if &plainText=true was specified as a URL parameter.

        This indicates that the Content-Type of the output should always be set to "text/plain" to make it easy to render in a browser.

        This feature is useful for debugging.

        Returns:
        true if &amp;plainText=true was specified as a URL parameter

      • getJavaMethod

        public Method getJavaMethod()
        Returns the java method handling the request.

        Can be used to access the method name or method annotations during requests, such as in calls to RestGuard.guard(RestRequest, RestResponse).

        Notes:
        • This returns null when evaluating servlet-level guards since the method has not been resolved at that point of execution.
        Returns:
        The Java method handling the request, or null if the method has not yet been resolved.

      • getReaderResource

        public ReaderResource getReaderResource(String name,
                                        boolean resolveVars,
                                        MediaType mediaType)
                                 throws IOException
        Returns an instance of a ReaderResource that represents the contents of a resource text file from the classpath.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the resource (i.e. the value normally passed to Class.getResourceAsStream(String).
        resolveVars - If true, any Parameter variables will be resolved by the variable resolver returned by getVarResolverSession().
        mediaType - The value to set as the "Content-Type" header for this object.
        Returns:
        A new reader resource, or null if resource could not be found.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • getReaderResource

        public ReaderResource getReaderResource(String name,
                                        boolean resolveVars)
                                 throws IOException
        Same as getReaderResource(String, boolean, MediaType) except uses the resource mime-type map constructed using RestConfig.addMimeTypes(String...) to determine the media type.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the resource (i.e. the value normally passed to Class.getResourceAsStream(String).
        resolveVars - If true, any Parameter variables will be resolved by the variable resolver returned by getVarResolverSession().
        Returns:
        A new reader resource, or null if resource could not be found.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • getSwaggerFromFile

        protected Swagger getSwaggerFromFile()
        Returns the localized Swagger from the file system.

        Looks for a file called "{ServletClass}_{locale}.json" in the same package as this servlet and returns it as a parsed Swagger object.

        Returned objects are cached for later quick-lookup.

        Returns:
        The parsed swagger object, or null if the swagger file could not be found.
